body_html:
I believe this still hasn't been addressed as of version 1.0.0a0+dd2c487.
I believe though that we should support arbitrary iterables of tensors. Also, the error message is not good, because we support lists of tensors as well (not only tuple of tensors).
My two cents: we should just call tuple(tensors) in the beginning of the function call.
This also apply to other functions, like torch.cat, where a similar discussion has been raised, see #10182
body_text:
I believe this still hasn't been addressed as of version 1.0.0a0+dd2c487.
I believe though that we should support arbitrary iterables of tensors. Also, the error message is not good, because we support lists of tensors as well (not only tuple of tensors).
My two cents: we should just call tuple(tensors) in the beginning of the function call.
This also apply to other functions, like torch.cat, where a similar discussion has been raised, see #10182
body:
I believe this still hasn't been addressed as of version `1.0.0a0+dd2c487`.
I believe though that we should support arbitrary iterables of tensors. Also, the error message is not good, because we support lists of tensors as well (not only tuple of tensors).
My two cents: we should just call `tuple(tensors)` in the beginning of the function call.
This also apply to other functions, like `torch.cat`, where a similar discussion has been raised, see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/10182
